trans-unit.source: Get Started with Mobile Services for Xamarin iOS apps | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Mobile Services for Xamarin iOS apps | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for Xamarin iOS development
trans-unit.target: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for Xamarin iOS development

trans-unit.source: Get started with Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Get started with Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to a Xamarin iOS app using Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to a Xamarin iOS app using Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple _To do list_ app that stores app data in the new mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple _To do list_ app that stores app data in the new mobile service.

trans-unit.source: The mobile service that you will create uses the supported .NET languages using Visual Studio for server-side business logic and to manage the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: The mobile service that you will create uses the supported .NET languages using Visual Studio for server-side business logic and to manage the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: To create a mobile service that lets you write your server-side business logic in JavaScript, see the [JavaScript backend version] of this topic.
trans-unit.target: To create a mobile service that lets you write your server-side business logic in JavaScript, see the [JavaScript backend version] of this topic.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]This topic shows you how to create a new mobile service project by using the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]This topic shows you how to create a new mobile service project by using the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: By using Visual Studio 2013 Update 2, you can also add a new mobile service project to an existing Visual Studio solution.
trans-unit.target: By using Visual Studio 2013 Update 2, you can also add a new mobile service project to an existing Visual Studio solution.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Quickstart: Add a mobile service (.NET backend)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn629482.aspx)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Quickstart: Add a mobile service (.NET backend)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn629482.aspx)

trans-unit.source: A screenshot from the completed app is below:
trans-unit.target: A screenshot from the completed app is below:

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Services tutorials for Xamarin iOS apps.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Services tutorials for Xamarin iOS apps.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free mobile services that you can keep using even after your trial ends.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free mobile services that you can keep using even after your trial ends.

trans-unit.source: For details, see Azure Free Trial.
trans-unit.target: For details, see Azure Free Trial.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires Visual Studio Professional 2013.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires Visual Studio Professional 2013.

trans-unit.source: A free trial version is available.
trans-unit.target: A free trial version is available.

trans-unit.source: Create a new mobile service
trans-unit.target: Create a new mobile service

trans-unit.source: Create a new Xamarin iOS app
trans-unit.target: Create a new Xamarin iOS app

trans-unit.source: Once you have created your mobile service, you can follow an easy quickstart in the Management Portal to either create a new app or modify an existing app to connect to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Once you have created your mobile service, you can follow an easy quickstart in the Management Portal to either create a new app or modify an existing app to connect to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In this section you will download a new Xamarin iOS app and a service project for your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this section you will download a new Xamarin iOS app and a service project for your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service that you just created.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service that you just created.

trans-unit.source: In the quickstart tab, click **Xamarin** under **Choose platform** and expand **Create a new Xamarin app**.
trans-unit.target: In the quickstart tab, click **Xamarin** under **Choose platform** and expand **Create a new Xamarin app**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the three easy steps to create a Xamarin iOS app connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This displays the three easy steps to create a Xamarin iOS app connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already done so, download and install Visual Studio Professional 2013 on your local computer or virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already done so, download and install Visual Studio Professional 2013 on your local computer or virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Download and install [Xcode] v4.4 or a later version and [Xamarin Studio].
trans-unit.target: Download and install [Xcode] v4.4 or a later version and [Xamarin Studio].

trans-unit.source: You can also use Xamarin for Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: You can also use Xamarin for Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Under **Download and publish your service to the cloud**, select **iOS** and click **Download**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Download and publish your service to the cloud**, select **iOS** and click **Download**.

trans-unit.source: This downloads a solution contains projects for both the mobile service and for the sample _To do list_ application that is connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This downloads a solution contains projects for both the mobile service and for the sample _To do list_ application that is connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.
trans-unit.target: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.

trans-unit.source: Download your publish profile, save the downloaded file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.
trans-unit.target: Download your publish profile, save the downloaded file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.

trans-unit.source: Test the mobile service
trans-unit.target: Test the mobile service

trans-unit.source: Publish your mobile service
trans-unit.target: Publish your mobile service

trans-unit.source: Run the Xamarin iOS app
trans-unit.target: Run the Xamarin iOS app

trans-unit.source: The final stage of this tutorial is to build and run your new app.
trans-unit.target: The final stage of this tutorial is to build and run your new app.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the client project within the mobile service solution, in either Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the client project within the mobile service solution, in either Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio.

trans-unit.source: Press the **Run** button to build the client project and start the app in the iPhone emulator.
trans-unit.target: Press the **Run** button to build the client project and start the app in the iPhone emulator.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type meaningful text, such as _Complete the tutorial_ and then click the plus (**+**) icon.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type meaningful text, such as _Complete the tutorial_ and then click the plus (**+**) icon.

trans-unit.source: This sends a POST request to the new mobile service hosted in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This sends a POST request to the new mobile service hosted in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Data from the request is inserted into the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: Data from the request is inserted into the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile service, and the data is displayed in the list.
trans-unit.target: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile service, and the data is displayed in the list.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]You can review the code that accesses your mobile service to query and insert data in the QSTodoService.cs C# file.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]You can review the code that accesses your mobile service to query and insert data in the QSTodoService.cs C# file.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you have completed the quickstart, learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:
trans-unit.target: Now that you have completed the quickstart, learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:

trans-unit.source: [Get started with offline data sync]
trans-unit.target: [Get started with offline data sync]

trans-unit.source: Learn how the quickstart uses offline data sync to make the app responsive and robust.
trans-unit.target: Learn how the quickstart uses offline data sync to make the app responsive and robust.

trans-unit.source: [Get started with authentication]
trans-unit.target: [Get started with authentication]

trans-unit.source: Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.

trans-unit.source: [Get started with push notifications]
trans-unit.target: [Get started with push notifications]

trans-unit.source: Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app.

trans-unit.source: [Troubleshoot a Mobile Services .NET backend]
trans-unit.target: [Troubleshoot a Mobile Services .NET backend]

trans-unit.source: Learn how to diagnose and fix issues that can arise with a Mobile Services .NET backend.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to diagnose and fix issues that can arise with a Mobile Services .NET backend.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
